messages.subject: Re: chicken pox
messages.msgSnippet: Might a person ask the same question reguarding taking the vaccine?: how do you know I will get the disease at all ? Pat ... hadn t mentioned anything to my
messages.messageBody:
Might a person ask the same question reguarding taking the
vaccine?: "how do you know I will get the disease at all"?

Pat



--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Mary" <mummy124@b...>
wrote:
> Well when I wrote in to ask about the whole chicken pox thing, I
hadn't mentioned anything to my husband yet. So when I mentioned I
was thinking of exposing the kids, he asked if I was crazy!! LOL.
>
> So we had a discussion about it and when I said it might be better
for them to get it now, he asked how I was sure they would ever get
it at all. Well I couldn't be really.
>
> So he called the 3 younger children in and explained what we were
talking about and asked them what they wanted to do. None of them
wanted it now. And when I mentioned it might be worse if they got it
later, they all responded the same way my husband had. How did I know
they would get it at all? After all, I never had it.
>
> So it's settled. Life goes on and we see what happens.
>
> Thanks for all the great thought provoking posts.
>
> Mary B
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: chicken pox
messages.msgSnippet: Well when I wrote in to ask about the whole chicken pox thing, I hadn t mentioned anything to my husband yet. So when I mentioned I was thinking of exposing
messages.messageBody:
Well when I wrote in to ask about the whole chicken pox thing, I hadn't mentioned anything to my husband yet. So when I mentioned I was thinking of exposing the kids, he asked if I was crazy!! LOL.

So we had a discussion about it and when I said it might be better for them to get it now, he asked how I was sure they would ever get it at all. Well I couldn't be really.

So he called the 3 younger children in and explained what we were talking about and asked them what they wanted to do. None of them wanted it now. And when I mentioned it might be worse if they got it later, they all responded the same way my husband had. How did I know they would get it at all? After all, I never had it.

So it's settled. Life goes on and we see what happens.

Thanks for all the great thought provoking posts.

Mary B

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
